And just like that the Apple meeting is done. I actually came over to the Capital One Cafe. One of the things that sucks in Miami is they are a bunch of coffee shops but you never know if they have decent Wi-Fi connection. The first one I ended up at was terrible. So kind of funny that I ended up having the Apple meeting right next to the Apple store and the call that I'm working on is at the basis of their UI component library.

thoughts.content: The user wants an interactive visual timeline. I think React could work well here, and I can use React with Leaflet (react-leaflet) for map-based interactions. However, I‚Äôm wondering if using external libraries via CDN is tricky for previews. Since the user requested React, I'll stick with code/react, using Tailwind, to stay within guidelines. Time to build the component!

For the visual timeline, I‚Äôm thinking of using React with Leaflet and OpenStreetMap tiles. I can set up pins for cities like Bangkok, Istanbul, Chicago, Playa del Carmen, and Miami, and connect them with polylines. Pins will show episode info, dates, and cover placeholders. Since external libraries aren't ideal, I‚Äôll stick with basic React for easy iteration.

For the map, I‚Äôm thinking of using React with Tailwind for styling, plus some basic hover interactions. I‚Äôll keep animations subtle with framer-motion, but nothing overwhelming. Instead of relying on Leaflet, I could try a custom SVG world map with paths, or maybe explore other simple options like Google Maps. Let‚Äôs keep it lightweight.

I think a simple, stylized grid could work well for the map, with mini-cards and arcs drawn using SVG‚Äîno need for a base map. Using percentage-based coordinates for location positions, I can add responsive pins and clickable popovers. A subtle world map silhouette could be nice to include‚Äîkeeping it lightweight. Let‚Äôs go with that!

Okay so after the smoke shop I went back to the apartment rent stop and took a nap. When I woke up it was about 5:00 5:30. I went to the courts but everyone already had a partner. So I just watched some good games. Ended up talking to a friend from volleyball. Lucas. He's battling on addiction with kratom. He's trying to kick it so we spent some time just talking about life and what it means to get to know yourself without any substance in your system. Keeps been on prescription medication since he's been a child so he doesn't even know what it's like to not be on medications. I shared the the accountability ledger that I recorded in one of the turkey episodes. I shared the idea with him and he seemed very receptive to it and thankful. So that was nice and then went back home. I changed to go out and met up with another friend Plamena. Funny enough we went at a Kratom spot. And they're becoming really popular in South Beach and a lot of people are addicted to them.
